prompt.prompt:
Please identify ONLY the guidelines that DIRECTLY address the management of this specific clinical issue. 
The guidelines must contain specific recommendations or protocols for managing this exact condition.

Rules:
- Select ONLY guidelines the most relevant 1 or 2 guidelines that have this issue as their primary focus
- Return ONLY the exact filenames of relevant guidelines
- List each filename on a new line
- Do not add any additional text or explanations

Issue: Hyperlipidemia

Available guidelines:
ESHRE PIL - Endometriosis.txt: Endometriosis booklet: Chronic disease affecting 2-10% of women. Symptoms: pelvic pain, reduced quality of life, infertility. Dx: clinical exam, laparoscopy. Mgmt: meds, hormones, surgery. Fertility options: surgery, assisted reproduction. Key: communicate with doctor for treatment plan.
Uptodate - Approach to the patient with pregnancy of unknown location.txt: PUL: Signs/Sx: Asymptomatic or vaginal bleeding/abdominal pain; Mgmt: Evaluate with TVUS, serial hCG, clinical judgment guides further workup & management based on stability and pregnancy desires.
UHSussex - Fetal Heart Monitoring Guideline.txt: Fetal Heart Monitoring: Antenatal cCTG at 26/40 for severe pre-term pregnancies. Intrapartum: IA for low-risk, CTG for high-risk. CTG hourly review, escalate if needed. Deceleration classification: normal, suspicious, pathological with actions.
GTG 2010 - Malaria in Pregnancy - Treatment.txt: Malaria in pregnancy: Early diagnosis/treatment crucial. Symptoms: flu-like, fever, chills, headache, muscle pain, nausea, vomiting. Mgmt: IV artesunate/quinine for severe falciparum, chloroquine for non-falciparum, regular monitoring essential.
UHSussex - MP019 - Hypertension and Pre-eclampsia in Pregnancy.txt: Hypertension and preeclampsia in pregnancy protocol: Assess, manage hypertensive disorders promptly. Use labetalol, nifedipine, methyldopa. Monitor BP, fetal well-being, consider delivery.
ESHRE Guideline - 2022 - Endometriosis.txt: ESHRE guideline for endometriosis: Dx: Pain, infertility; Mgmt: Hormones, surgery based on symptoms, preferences, fertility goals. Surgical improves symptoms, quality of life. Adjunct medical therapy. Non-medical approaches: Acupuncture, physiotherapy, exercise, electrotherapy, psychological interventions. Surgical for infertility: Laparoscopy, EFI, IUI. Medical fertility therapies uncertain. Pregnancy risks, complications. Recurrence prevention: Cystectomy, post-surgery hormones. Recurrent: Dienogest, leuprolide, OCP, surgery. Adolescents: Dx, hormonal contraceptives, surgery if needed. Postmenopausal: Surgery recommended; aromatase inhibitors alternative. Extrapelvic endometriosis: Surgical removal. Monitor asymptomatic cases. Hormones' varying cancer risk effects. Bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy not recommended without risk factors. Excision reduces ovarian cancer risk.
UHSussex - MP049 - Assisted Vaginal Birth.txt: Assisted Vaginal Birth: Protocol for safe operative vaginal delivery, consent, analgesia, hygiene, neonatal resuscitation, post-delivery care, documentation, and debriefing.
Uptodate - 2025 - Uterine fibroids (leiomyomas) Treatment overview - UpToDate.txt: Uterine fibroids: Tx options incl expectant mgmt, hysteroscopic resection, hormonal therapy, UAE, myomectomy. Laparoscopic myomectomy preferred for fertility.
BJOG - 2021 - Navaratnam - Amniocentesis and chorionic villus sampling.txt: Amniocentesis & chorionic villus sampling (CVS): Mgmt: Perform after 15 weeks, avoid before 10 weeks. Review bloodborne virus screening. Infection, failed procedures, fetal injury risks. Maintaining good practice is crucial.
BJOG - 2020 - Murphy - Assisted Vaginal Birth.txt: Assisted Vaginal Birth: Ind: fetal compromise, lack of progress, maternal distress; Mgmt: ultrasound, consent, experienced operator, episiotomy, prophylactic abx, thromboprophylaxis, analgesia, psych support.
BJOG - 2016 - Diagnosis and Management of Ectopic Pregnancy.txt: Ectopic Pregnancy: Dx by TVUS; Mgmt: Serum b-hCG for planning, surgical/pharm/conserv options, anti-D, fertility, support, counseling, methotrexate 1st line, expectant select, tailored, lap for cornual, definitive for ovarian, anti-D for RhD-, 3-month wait after MTX.
UHSussex - MP059 - Baby Abduction Policy.txt: Baby Abduction Policy: Staff must prevent and respond swiftly to abductions. Immediate action: Inform security, contact police. Ongoing: Check IDs, reassure parents, cooperate with police. Training for staff on abduction risks. Policy ensures fairness, respect, and human rights principles.
UHSussex - Obstetric VTE - 2025.txt: Obstetric VTE: Prevention of VTE in pregnancy. Assess risk factors, consider LMWH thromboprophylaxis unless contraindicated. Promptly investigate/manage DVT/PE symptoms. LMWH preferred treatment. Follow-up with multidisciplinary team.
BJOG - 2017 -  Prevention of Early‐onset Neonatal Group B Streptococcal Disease.txt: Prevention of Early-onset Neonatal Group B Streptococcal Disease: IAP for known carriers at term; no routine screening; monitor for signs of infection.
UHSussex - MP064 - Hyponatraemia in Labour.txt: Hyponatraemia in Labour: Prevention: Encourage oral intake, monitor fluid balance. Management: Treat severe cases symptomatically, strict fluid restriction, hourly sodium checks, 1.8% NaCl bolus under ITU guidance.
UHSussex - MP048 - Shoulder Dystocia.txt: Shoulder Dystocia: Dx: Gentle traction. Mgmt: McRoberts' + suprapubic pressure, avoid lateral/downward traction. Post-Delivery: Risk PPH, tears. Training key.
UHSussex - MP046 - Management of Breech and ECV.txt: Breech presentation: Mgmt: ECV at 36-37w, consider moxibustion. Contraindications: previa, hemorrhage, preeclampsia. Birth options: ECV, LSCS, vaginal birth. Risks: perinatal, maternal. Vaginal breech birth: Assess risks, birth plan, continuous CTG, upright position, pain relief, support. Delivery: Maneuvers based on exp, no traction, selective episiotomy, manage delays. Planned LSCS for preterm, twin breech.
UHSussex - MP055 - Perinatal Collapse in Pregnancy & Puerperium.txt: Perinatal Collapse: Call for help, basic life support, oxygen, venous access, fluid resuscitation, MEOWS for monitoring, involve specialists, debriefing, audit compliance.
ESHRE - PCOS - 2023.txt: PCOS 2023 Guideline: 254 recommendations for evidence-based care, emphasizing diverse PCOS features, refined diagnostic criteria, and improved medical and fertility management.
Uptodate - 2025 - Prelabor rupture of membranes at term.txt: PROM at term: Mgmt: Induce labor with oxytocin to reduce infection risk; consider expectant mgmt for uncomplicated cases; hospitalize for monitoring; avoid prophylactic abx unless GBS+.
Guideline No. 452 Diagnosis and Management of Intrahepatic Cholestasis of Pregnancy.txt: ICP: Signs/Sx: Itching, elevated bile acids; Mgmt: Ursodeoxycholic acid for itching, planned early birth based on bile acid levels, continuous fetal monitoring during labor.
UHSussex - MD090 - Disengaging a Deeply Impacted head at LSCS and use of Fetal Pillow.txt: LSCS with deeply impacted fetal head: Fetal Pillow: Elevates head by 2-4cm; Indications: failed instrumental delivery, full dilatation cesarean; Operator training essential; Document key outcomes during procedure.
Uptodate - 2025 - Preexisting and gestational diabetes - Intrapartum and postpartum glucose management.txt: Diabetes in pregnancy: Mgmt: Maintain glucose 70-125 mg/dL during labor, avoid maternal hyperglycemia to prevent adverse outcomes. Individualized insulin management, consider continuous glucose monitoring. Insulin pump users can continue during labor, adjust postpartum insulin dosing. Metformin use varies. Breastfeeding may lower insulin needs. Close glucose monitoring postpartum, follow-up testing recommended.
GTG 2015 - Birth After Previous CS.txt: VBAC: Most suitable with single prior C-section. Contraindications: uterine rupture, classical scar. Success rate 72-75%. ERCS after 39+0 wks. Induction/augmentation ↑ rupture risk. Consider factors for rupture. Expertise for ≥2 prior C-sections.
BJOG - 2022 - Girling - Intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy.txt: ICP: Consider ICP in pregnant women with itching, bile acid >19 micromol/L. Active management with early birth reduces adverse outcomes. No routine treatments improve outcomes or reduce bile acid levels. Postnatal resolution confirmed with normal liver tests. Risk of stillbirth increases with peak bile acids >100 micromol/L. Close monitoring, no routine additional tests. Ursodeoxycholic acid not recommended for perinatal outcomes.
BJOG - 2017 -  External Cephalic Version and Reducing the Incidence of Term Breech Presentation.txt: ECV: Procedure to turn breech baby to head-down position. Success ~50%, reduces C-section chance. Tocolysis with betamimetics can improve success.
BJOG - 2017 -  Management of Inherited Bleeding Disorders in Pregnancy.txt: Inherited Bleeding Disorders in Pregnancy: Genetic counseling, multidisciplinary care, maintain factor levels, specific treatments, personalized approach, avoid central neuraxial anesthesia, NSAIDs, postpartum thromboprophylaxis in severe deficiencies. Neonatal testing, CVS 11-13+6 wks, amniocentesis after 15 wks or >34 wks, maternal blood sample needed. Amniocentesis in late pregnancy informs childbirth management, PGD for heritable disorders. Neonatal bleeding risks stratified into high, medium, mild, unlikely levels. Management based on factor deficiencies and platelet activity in neonates.
NICE Guidance - 2010 - Hysterectomy for Endometrial Cancer.txt: Lap hyst for endometrial cancer: Safe/effective with proper governance. Multidisciplinary team selects patients. Requires advanced lap skills. Aims for less invasive, shorter recovery vs open surgery. Lower complications but variable conversion rates. More data needed for long-term outcomes.
GTG 2011 - APH.txt: APH: Signs/Sx: Vaginal bleeding, maternal shock, fetal compromise; Mgmt: Maternal resusc, determine cause, monitor fetal status, consider delivery based on condition. Delivery: Signs/Sx: N/A; Mgmt: Mat resusc, delivery to control bleeding, consider C-section if maternal/fetal compromise.
GTG 2015 - Blood transfusion in Obstetrics.txt: Blood Transfusion in Obstetrics: Optimize Hb levels prenatally, obtain consent for transfusion, use cell salvage for significant blood loss, monitor clotting tests, consider tranexamic acid for hemorrhage, manage anemia to reduce transfusion need.
UHSussex - Cord Prolapse Protocol.txt: Cord Prolapse Mgmt: Immediate action crucial. Methods: bladder filling. Hospital: Cat 1 C-section in 30 min for non-reassuring fetal heart rate. Training, monitoring, postnatal debriefing advised.
UHSussex - MP053 - Obstetric Haemorrhage.txt: Obstetric Hemorrhage Protocol: Covers antepartum/postpartum hemorrhage, placental issues, women declining blood products. Guidelines for management and communication among staff. Ensure clear communication, summon correct team for major hemorrhage, monitor blood components, consider antibiotics/surgery for persistent bleeding. Postnatal care involves monitoring and follow-up. Ultrasound for placental site. Individualized management plan for women declining blood products. Oxytocics post-delivery, FBC before discharge. Thromboprophylaxis post-bleeding. Debriefing and follow-up recommended. Datix for MOHs >1500ml.
GTG 2015 - FGM.txt: FGM: Clinicians aware of complications, UK law. Offer de-infibulation before pregnancy. Postnatal care includes follow-up. Referral to specialists for antenatal care. Screening for hepatitis C. High obstetric risk. Maternal history documented. Notify child protection midwife for baby girl. Offer postnatal follow-up for de-infibulation.
UHSussex - MP056 - Obstetric High Dependency Care.txt: Obstetric HDU Care: Maternity patients at Level 1 risk. Staff must document transfers, provide one-to-one care. Contact Critical Care Outreach team.
RCOG - Birth After Previous Caesarean Section - 2015.txt: VBAC vs. ERCS: Consider individual factors for mode of delivery. VBAC has risks of uterine rupture; ERCS has neonatal respiratory morbidity.
BJOG - 2022 - Stock - Antenatal corticosteroids to reduce neonatal morbidity and mortality.txt: Antenatal corticosteroids benefit preterm birth <34+6 weeks, reduce RDS. Caution: late preterm, multiple pregnancies, diabetes. Administer within 48 hours before birth. Balance risks with benefits. Avoid delay in serious conditions.
Clinical Consensus No. 455 Fetal Sex Determination and Disclosure.txt: Fetal Sex Determination: Importance in obstetric ultrasound; respect parental wishes; efforts for determination; alert in reports; re-examination if needed.
GTG 2008 - Prevention of Entry-Related Laparoscopic Injuries.txt: Laparoscopic entry injuries prevention: Trocar 90° to skin, Veress needle or Hasson approach. Surgeon training crucial. Maintain 20-25 mmHg intra-abdominal pressure. Consider alternative entry sites based on patient characteristics.
GTG 2014 - Endometrial Hyperplasia.txt: Endometrial hyperplasia: Monitor risk factors, use WHO classification, biopsy for diagnosis, manage with progestogens, consider LNG-IUS first-line.
Joint RCOG BASHH Guideline - Genital Herpes in Pregnancy.txt: Genital herpes in pregnancy: Mgmt: Aciclovir for first episode, consider suppressive therapy from 36 weeks, CS for third trimester acquisition, assess HSV type, plan delivery accordingly.
NICE Guidance - 2024 - Endometriosis.txt: Endometriosis: Signs/Sx: Chronic pelvic pain, infertility; Mgmt: Consider laparoscopy for diagnosis, excision for endometriomas, discuss surgical options for fertility.
Joint RCOG BSGE Guideline - Suspected Ovarian Masses in Premenopausal Women.txt: Ovarian Masses in Premenopausal Women: Initial assessment with CA-125, ultrasound. Conservative/laparoscopic management for benign masses. Consider gyn onc referral for suspicious cases. Yearly follow-up for simple cysts. Laparoscopic approach preferred for elective surgery.
UHSussex - MP076 - Maternal death.txt: Maternal Death Protocol: Objective standards for managing maternal deaths. Notify key personnel, preserve scene, inform next of kin, complete documentation. Medical Examiner referral, religious considerations, hot debriefing, registration info, certification procedures.
GTG 2010 - Malaria in Pregnancy - Prevention.txt: Malaria prevention in pregnancy: Educate on risk, bite prevention, chemoprophylaxis; consider mefloquine in 2nd/3rd trimester, seek specialist advice. Standby treatment with quinine or atovaquone-proguanil.
GTG 2016 - Epilepsy in Pregnancy.txt: Epilepsy in Pregnancy: Dx by neurologist, manage AEDs for fetal risk/seizure control. Folic acid reduces malformations. Antenatal care, labor seizure mgmt, postnatal AED use, neonatal monitoring. Contraception crucial. Educate on risks, benefits, AED effects on fetus.
BMS - 2024 - Management of unscheduled bleeding on HRT.txt: BMS GUIDELINE: Unscheduled bleeding on HRT - Assess cancer risk factors, bleeding pattern - Investigate if needed - Adjust HRT regimen for management.
BASHH - 2014 - Mx of Vulval Conditions.txt: 2014 UK National Guideline on Vulval Conditions: General advice for all conditions, referral guidelines, specific management for lichen sclerosus, lichen planus, eczema, psoriasis, VIN, and vulvodynia. Topical steroids, biopsy, and multidisciplinary approach advised.
GTG 2011 - Pregnancy and Breast Cancer.txt: Breast Cancer in Pregnancy: Prognosis not worsened vs. non-pregnant. Treatment based on tumor characteristics and pregnancy stage. Contraception: Non-hormonal methods recommended post-treatment. Pregnancy after breast cancer: Consult oncologist, surgeon, and obstetrician. Consider fertility preservation options before treatment.
UHSussex - Nausea and Vomiting in Pregnancy + Hyperemesis Gravidarum - 2025.txt: NVP & HG Mgmt: Antiemetics (pyridoxine, doxylamine, cyclizine), thiamine for severe cases. Monitor renal function, mental health. Refer if needed.
NICE - 2021 - Antenatal Care.txt: Antenatal care guidelines emphasize involving partners, assessing risks, monitoring fetal growth, discussing birth preferences, and managing common issues.
GTG 2012 - Initial Mx of Chronic Pelvic Pain.txt: Chronic pelvic pain: Multifactorial symptom, not diagnosis. Initial assessment for contributing factors, referral if needed. Mgmt: Hormonal, antispasmodics, self-management, support.
GTG 2015 - Chickenpox in Pregnancy.txt: Chickenpox in Pregnancy: Mgmt: Varicella vaccination, avoid exposure, VZIG if exposed, aciclovir for infected, hospital referral for severe cases, individualized delivery. Neonatal risks discussed.
BJOG - 2022 - Shennan - Cervical Cerclage.txt: Cervical Cerclage: Offer for history-indicated cerclage in high-risk women. Consider for short cervix <25mm in singleton pregnancies. Transvaginal cerclage placed high. Individualized decision-making for emergency cerclage. Watch for complications like PPROM, infection.
RCOG - 2025 - GTG 76 -Management of Thyroid Disorders in Pregnancy.txt: Thyroid Disorders in Pregnancy: Trimester-specific TSH, fT4 ranges; iodine, levothyroxine, antithyroid drugs as needed; postpartum thyroiditis follow-up; monitor thyroid antibodies; consider selenium; document protocol deviations.
NICE Guidance - 2023 - Ectopic.txt: Ectopic pregnancy and miscarriage: Diagnosis and management guidelines aim to improve early pregnancy loss diagnosis and support, emphasizing prompt referral for suspected ectopic pregnancy. Recommendations include offering pregnancy tests, ultrasound scans, and appropriate treatments based on hCG levels and clinical criteria. Standardizing practices and further research on psychological impacts are important for optimizing care and outcomes.
BJOG - 2024 - DeÂ Silva - Outpatient Hysteroscopy.txt: Outpatient hysteroscopy: Recommend dedicated service for abnormal bleeding & reproductive issues. Provide pre-op info, consider analgesia, avoid routine sedation. Vaginoscopy preferred, use mechanical tissue removal systems, consider NSAIDs for pain.
UHS Anaemia in pregancy UHS-CG-0008-2023 (3).txt: Anaemia in Pregnancy: Signs/Sx: Fatigue, dizziness, SOB; Mgmt: Screen at booking & 28 weeks, oral iron replacement, consider IV iron if needed.
UHSussex - MP044 - Failed intubation in the Obstetric patient.txt: Failed Intubation Obstetric Patient: Protocol for general anesthesia in peri-partum period. Algorithmic approach per OAA/DAS 2015 guideline.
FIGO - 2015 - Intrapartum Fetal Monitoring - Cardiotocography.txt: CTG: Indications: Continuous monitoring for high fetal risk; avoid routine use in low-risk women. Analysis: Evaluate baseline, variability, accelerations, decelerations. Mgmt: Prompt action for suspected hypoxia, address underlying causes, avoid unnecessary interventions.
Joint RCOG and BSGE Guideline- Laparoscopy in Pregnancy.txt: Laparoscopic surgery for non-obstetric abdominal conditions in pregnancy is safe, with maternal and fetal outcomes generally good. Expert laparoscopists are crucial for safety. Factors like gestation, expertise, and patient preference should guide the choice of surgery. Maternal and fetal risks should be carefully managed by a multidisciplinary team.
BHIVA - 2020 - HIV Guideline.txt: HIV in pregnancy: MDT antenatal care, cART, delivery based on viral load, infant PEP, postpartum cART, cervical cytology, infant testing. HIV/HBV co-infection: TDF, FTC, LAM, monitor liver enzymes, HAV vaccine, continue cART postpartum.
BJOG - 2018 - Denison - Care of Women with Obesity in Pregnancy.txt: Obesity in Pregnancy: Prepreg care: Optimize weight, folic acid 5mg, no weight loss drugs. Antenatal care: Screen for GDM, BP cuff size, aspirin for risks. Caesarean: Prophylactic antibiotics, suturing subcutaneous fat. Postpartum: Weight loss support, contraception. Cesarean vs. induction in class III obesity: risks include postpartum hemorrhage, wound complications, infection. Breastfeeding support crucial.
BJOG - 2016 -  - Management of Bladder Pain Syndrome.txt: BPS: Initial assess incl med hx, exam, bladder diary, UTI test. Mgmt: Diet modif, stress mgmt, analgesia. Consider intravesical tx if needed.
BJOG - 2017 -  Management of Breech Presentation.txt: Breech presentation at term: Mgmt: Offer ECV if no contraindication, counsel on risks/benefits of ECV, vaginal breech delivery vs. C-section. Delivery risks: C-section reduces perinatal mortality, planned vaginal breech birth has higher mortality risk. Maternal complications: C-section increases future pregnancy risks. Vaginal breech delivery safety depends on case selection, operator skill, intrapartum management. Position for delivery can be semirecumbent or all-fours. Assist delivery without traction if delay or poor fetal condition. Preterm breech birth: Individualized management, C-section if maternal/fetal compromise. Twin pregnancy: C-section for first twin, not routine for second twin. Support for vaginal breech delivery service. Recommendations for future research and audit.
ESHRE GUIDELINE ENDOMETRIOSI 2022.txt: ESHRE guidelines for endometriosis: Diagnosis: Clinical exam, imaging, laparoscopy. Mgmt: Hormones, surgery, fertility. Surgery improves pain/quality of life, but complications vary. Minimally invasive approach preferred. Nerve-sparing laparoscopy reduces risks. Fertility: Operative laparoscopy, Endometriosis Fertility Index, IUI, ART. Antibiotic prophylaxis for endometriomas. Pregnancy risks: Miscarriage, ectopic, preterm birth, stillbirth, SGA, CS. Recurrence Mgmt: Surgery, hormones, OCP, LNG-IUS. Adolescents: Hormonal contraceptives, NSAIDs; Postmenopausal: Surgery, aromatase inhibitors. Extrapelvic Endometriosis: Imaging, surgery, hormones. Asymptomatic: Monitor if necessary. Prevention: Healthy lifestyle, no hormonal contraceptives. Cancer Risk: Small increase in ovarian, breast, thyroid cancer; individualized screening. Guidelines: Based on GRADE, expert opinion, stakeholder review.
BJOG - 2019 - Thomson - Care of Women Presenting with Suspected Preterm Prelabour Rupture of Membranes from 24 0 Weeks of.txt: PPROM: Dx by maternal history, sterile speculum exam; Use IGFBP-1/PAMG-1 if no fluid; Mgmt: Erythromycin 10d, corticosteroids 24-33+6wks, MgSO4 in labor 24-29+6wks.
Uptodate - Pregnancy Loss Ultrasound Diagnosis.txt: Pregnancy loss diagnosis: Utilize transvaginal ultrasound for early pregnancy loss confirmation. Criteria include sac diameter, cardiac activity, and embryo presence. Consider patient preferences.
UHSussex - MP050 - Caesarean Section.txt: C-section protocol: Key principles, classification, prep, and management outlined. Emphasizes documentation, suturing practices, cord clamping, oxytocin use, and wound care.
BJOG - 2020 -  Management of Gestational Trophoblastic Disease.txt: Molar Pregnancy: Signs/Sx: Irregular vaginal bleeding, positive pregnancy test, uterine enlargement, hyperthyroidism; Mgmt: Suction curettage, histological diagnosis, referral to GTD center for persistently elevated hCG.
NICE Guideline - 2021 - IOL.txt: Inducing labor: Discuss birth preferences early; consider risks of waiting beyond 41 weeks; monitor fetal wellbeing; offer pain relief; manage complications.
Guideline No. 451 Asymptomatic Endometrial Thickening in Postmenopausal Women.txt: Endometrial thickening in postmenopausal women: <11mm no investigations if no bleeding/risk factors. >11mm + findings may need sampling or further tests.

APH: Signs/Sx: Vaginal bleeding, maternal shock, fetal compromise; Mgmt: Maternal resusc, determine cause, monitor fetal status, consider delivery based on condition. Delivery: Signs/Sx: N/A; Mgmt: Mat resusc, delivery to control bleeding, consider C-section if maternal/fetal compromise.

Ultrasound for placental site. Individualized management plan for women declining blood products. Oxytocics post-delivery, FBC before discharge. Thromboprophylaxis post-bleeding. Breast Cancer in Pregnancy: Prognosis not worsened vs. non-pregnant. Treatment based on tumor characteristics and pregnancy stage. Contraception: Non-hormonal methods recommended post-treatment. Vaginal breech delivery safety depends on case selection, operator skill, intrapartum management. Position for delivery can be semirecumbent or all-fours. Assist delivery without traction if delay or poor fetal condition. Preterm breech birth: Individualized management, C-section if maternal/fetal compromise. Twin pregnancy: C-section for first twin, not routine for second twin. Support for vaginal breech delivery service. Recommendations for future research and audit.
ESHRE GUIDELINE ENDOMETRIOSI 2022.txt: ESHRE guidelines for endometriosis: Diagnosis: Clinical exam, imaging, laparoscopy. Mgmt: Hormones, surgery, fertility. Surgery improves pain/quality of life, but complications vary. Minimally invasive approach preferred. Nerve-sparing laparoscopy reduces risks. Fertility: Operative laparoscopy, Endometriosis Fertility Index, IUI, ART. Antibiotic prophylaxis for endometriomas. Pregnancy risks: Miscarriage, ectopic, preterm birth, stillbirth, SGA, CS. Recurrence Mgmt: Surgery, hormones, OCP, LNG-IUS. Adolescents: Hormonal contraceptives, NSAIDs; Postmenopausal: Surgery, aromatase inhibitors. Extrapelvic Endometriosis: Imaging, surgery, hormones. Asymptomatic: Monitor if necessary. Prevention: Healthy lifestyle, no hormonal contraceptives. Cancer Risk: Small increase in ovarian, breast, thyroid cancer; individualized screening. Guidelines: Based on GRADE, expert opinion, stakeholder review.
BJOG - 2019 - Thomson - Care of Women Presenting with Suspected Preterm Prelabour Rupture of Membranes from 24 0 Weeks of.txt: PPROM: Dx by maternal history, sterile speculum exam; Use IGFBP-1/PAMG-1 if no fluid; Mgmt: Erythromycin 10d, corticosteroids 24-33+6wks, MgSO4 in labor 24-29+6wks.
Uptodate - Pregnancy Loss Ultrasound Diagnosis.txt: Pregnancy loss diagnosis: Utilize transvaginal ultrasound for early pregnancy loss confirmation. Criteria include sac diameter, cardiac activity, and embryo presence. Consider patient preferences.
UHSussex - MP050 - Caesarean Section.txt: C-section protocol: Key principles, classification, prep, and management outlined. Emphasizes documentation, suturing practices, cord clamping, oxytocin use, and wound care.
BJOG - 2020 -  Management of Gestational Trophoblastic Disease.txt: Molar Pregnancy: Signs/Sx: Irregular vaginal bleeding, positive pregnancy test, uterine enlargement, hyperthyroidism; Mgmt: Suction curettage, histological diagnosis, referral to GTD center for persistently elevated hCG.
NICE Guideline - 2021 - IOL.txt: Inducing labor: Discuss birth preferences early; consider risks of waiting beyond 41 weeks; monitor fetal wellbeing; offer pain relief; manage complications.
Guideline No. 451 Asymptomatic Endometrial Thickening in Postmenopausal Women.txt: Endometrial thickening in postmenopausal women: <11mm no investigations if no bleeding/risk factors. >11mm + findings may need sampling or further tests.",
